Deprecated API

Contents

  • Deprecated Interfaces
  • Deprecated Classes
  • Deprecated Methods
  • Deprecated Interfaces 
    Interface and Description
    org.javalite.activejdbc.Formatter
    Use Dialect to format query values.
  • Deprecated Classes 
    Class and Description
    org.javalite.activejdbc.validation.Converter
    use Converter instead
    org.javalite.activejdbc.validation.DateConverter
    use DateToStringConverter and StringToSqlDateConverter instead
    org.javalite.activejdbc.SimpleFormatter
    Use Dialect to format query values
    org.javalite.activejdbc.validation.TimestampConverter
    use DateToStringConverter and StringToTimestampConverter instead
    org.javalite.common.XmlEntities
    use Apache Commons or Escape instead
  • Deprecated Methods 
    Method and Description
    org.javalite.activejdbc.Model.addCallbacks(CallbackListener...)
    use Model.callbackWith(CallbackListener...) instead
    org.javalite.activejdbc.Model.attributes()
    use Model.attributeNames() instead
    org.javalite.activejdbc.ModelDelegate.attributes(Class<? extends Model>)
    use ModelDelegate.attributeNames(Class) instead
    org.javalite.activejdbc.Model.beforeClosingBrace(boolean, String, StringWriter)
    use Model.beforeClosingBrace(StringBuilder, boolean, String, String...) instead
    org.javalite.activejdbc.Model.beforeClosingTag(int, StringWriter, String...)
    use Model.beforeClosingTag(StringBuilder, boolean, String, String...) instead
    org.javalite.common.Util.close(Closeable)
    use Util.closeQuietly(AutoCloseable) instead. Two problems can arise if resources are not closed quietly in the finally block: (1) If there are multiple close() calls, and one of the first ones throws an Exception, then the following ones will never be called. (2) If an Exception is thrown inside the try { ... } catch block and another Exception is thrown by a close() call in the finally { ... } block, then the second Exception will hide the first one.
    org.javalite.activejdbc.ModelDelegate.convertDate(Class<? extends Model>, String, String)
    use {@link #dateFormat(Class, String, String...) instead
    org.javalite.activejdbc.Model.convertDate(String, String)
    use {@link #dateFormat(String, String...) instead
    org.javalite.activejdbc.validation.NumericValidationBuilder.convertNullIfEmpty()
    use Model.blankToNull(java.lang.String...) instead
    org.javalite.activejdbc.validation.NumericValidator.convertNullIfEmpty(boolean)
    use BlankToNullConverter instead
    org.javalite.activejdbc.ModelDelegate.convertTimestamp(Class<? extends Model>, String, String)
    use {@link #timestampFormat(Class, String, String...) instead
    org.javalite.activejdbc.Model.convertTimestamp(String, String)
    use {@link #timestampFormat(String, String...) instead
    org.javalite.activejdbc.ModelDelegate.convertWith(Class<? extends Model>, Converter)
    use ModelDelegate.convertWith(Class, org.javalite.activejdbc.conversion.Converter, String...) instead
    org.javalite.activejdbc.Model.convertWith(Converter)
    use Model.convertWith(org.javalite.activejdbc.conversion.Converter, String...) instead
    org.javalite.common.XmlEntities.escape(Writer, String)
    org.javalite.activejdbc.Model.find(String, ModelListener)
    use Model.findWith(ModelListener, String, Object...).
    org.javalite.activejdbc.connection_config.ConnectionJndiSpec.getPassword()
    unused method, returns null
    org.javalite.activejdbc.connection_config.ConnectionJndiSpec.getUser()
    unused method, returns null
    org.javalite.activejdbc.Registry.initialized()
    Not used anymore.
    org.javalite.activejdbc.statistics.StatisticsQueue.run()
    this method is deprecated and blank - does nothing. It will be removed in future versions
    org.javalite.activejdbc.Model.setTS(String, Date)
    use Model.setTimestamp(String, Object) instead.
    org.javalite.common.Inflector.shortName(String)
    Use clazz.getSimpleName() instead of Inflector.shortName(clazz.getName()).
    org.javalite.activejdbc.Model.toInsert(Formatter...)
    Use Model.toInsert(Dialect) instead.
    org.javalite.activejdbc.Model.toInsert(String, String)
    Use Model.toInsert(Dialect) instead.
    org.javalite.activejdbc.LazyList.toXml(int, boolean, String...)
    Use LazyList.toXml(boolean, boolean, String...) instead
    org.javalite.activejdbc.Model.toXml(int, boolean, String...)
    use Model.toXml(boolean, boolean, String...) instead
    org.javalite.common.XmlEntities.unescape(Writer, String)
